title: 75 years ago, the Allies launched an ambitious but ill-fated plan to end WWII — here are 6 things you didn't know about Operation Market Garden
text:
It's been 75 years since the launch of Operation Market Garden — the World War II mission to secure key bridges across Belgium and the Netherlands while pushing an Allied advance over the Rhine into Germany and ending the war in Europe by Christmas 1944.

Unfortunately, many of Market Garden's main aims failed, and the Christmas victory was not secured.

That doesn't mean this brainchild of British Field Marshal Sir Bernard Montgomery was a total failure. It was just slightly more ambitious than the Allies were prepared for. Here's why.
description: By late summer 1944, the Allies had sent the Germans reeling across France. That September, the Allies went for what they hoped would be a final blow.
